Wayne Rooney is reportedly ready to see out the remainder of his contract at Manchester United.

England' record scorer was close to leaving for China in January and was expected to move this summer, but that could change.

The Mail say he is willing to stay at Old Trafford, even if he is unwanted.

He has one year left on his £250,000-a-week deal, but Everton - a rumoured destination - are unable to match that figure.

MANCHESTER UNITED have been dealt a blow in their pursuit of Real Madrid star James Rodriguez, according to reports.

France Football claim PSG are in pole position to sign the former Monaco star.

It is said Rodriguez is in talks to sign for the Ligue 1 club after leaving his agent Jorge Mendes to settle his future.

Real Madrid apparently want around £61million for the midfielder and PSG are supposedly ready to meet their asking price.

Alvaro Morata has agreed a deal to join Manchester United and is now waiting for the Old Trafford club to negotiate a fee with Real Madrid.

As revealed by Telegraph Sport in April, United have made Morata their top target to replace Zlatan Ibrahimovic and are close to clinching his signature.

It is understood Morata has agreed in principle to the terms that will be offered to him at United and the transfer is now in the hands of the two clubs.

Alvaro Morata has agreed a deal to join Manchester United and is now waiting for the Old Trafford club to negotiate a fee with Real Madrid.

As revealed by Telegraph Sport in April, United have made Morata their top target to replace Zlatan Ibrahimovic and are close to clinching his signature.
